top_categories.workout_context: At 100 miles, Little Apple 100 - Illinois State Championship punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Little Apple 100 - Illinois State Championship rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Racing Little Apple 100 - Illinois State Championship isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Little Apple 100 - Illinois State Championship’s farmland gravel, rolling terrain demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Little Apple 100 - Illinois State Championship. Make this intensity feel like home.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Little Apple 100 - Illinois State Championship when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Little Apple 100 - Illinois State Championship’s illinois farmland gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Every session at Little Apple 100 - Illinois State Championship intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
At 100 miles, Little Apple 100 - Illinois State Championship rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Little Apple 100 - Illinois State Championship’s illinois farmland gravel delivers on race day.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Little Apple 100 - Illinois State Championship — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Little Apple 100 - Illinois State Championship — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on illinois farmland gravel.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Little Apple 100 - Illinois State Championship’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Little Apple 100 - Illinois State Championship requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on illinois farmland gravel to build confidence. Expect: farmland gravel, rolling terrain, state championship.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, TT Threshold, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 100 miles of illinois farmland gravel in Manhattan, Illinois.
